intro: Melolobium cernuum, commonly known as the drooping melolobium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Melolobium cernuum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
